frameDefinitions: A Lessee gains the use of Goods owned by a Lessor by payment to the Lessor.
Authorities charge a Suspect, who is under suspicion of having committed a crime (the Charges), and take him/her into custody.'
A Topical_entity has properties which are affected by the existence and association of an Entity.

An individual or group, the Patrol moves through and examines a Ground in order to ensure that it is in a generally Desired_state_of_affairs, particularly that it is safe and contains no dangerous Unwanted_entity.
An Agent removes a Theme from a Source so that the it is in the Agent's possession.
A Gatherer removes Crop ripe and ready to an accepted degree.
frameExamples: We are <t>renting</t> our apartment from a kind man named Tom.
The police <t>arrested</t> Harry on charges of manslaughter.
By the 1920s a characteristic book <t>had</t> black and white photographic illustrations only .
Detective Jones <t>patrolled</t> the northern half of the building.
Milton <t>took</t> the can of beer out of the refrigerator.
They <t>harvest</t> their pumpkins in the Autumn. INI
listRoleDefinitions: The individual that gains temporary use of the <fen>Goods</fen> by paying the <fen>Lessor</fen>
The role <fen>Goods</fen> is an item which is temporarily exchanged for <fen>Money</fen> in a transaction.
When the event occurs.
The location the renting takes place.
<fen>Charges</fen> identifies a category within the legal system; it is the crime with which the <fen>Suspect</fen> is charged.
The <fen>Authorities</fen> charge the <fen>Suspect</fen> with commiting a crime, and take him/her into custody.
The <fen>Suspect</fen> is taken into custody, under suspicion of having committed a crime.
<fen>Offense</fen> identifies the ordinary language use of the reason for which a <fen>Suspect</fen> is arrested.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the arrest occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the arrest occurs.
Some entity, abstract or concrete, which is stated to exist and be associated with the <fen>Topical_entity</fen>.
The entity under discussion, whose states and properties are impacted by its association with the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Entity</fen> exists and is associated with the <fen>Topical_entity</fen>
The place where the <fen>Entity</fen> is associated with the <fen>Topical_entity</fen>.
The person (or group) who inspects the <fen>Ground</fen> to see that it is safe.
The area that the <fen>Patrol</fen> inspects with to ensure its safety.
An entity whose presence would impair the desirability or safety of the <fen>Ground</fen>.
The desired outcome of the patrolling. Normally this constituent is a PP Complement headed by <ment>for</ment>, or a <ment>to</ment>-marked VP Complement.
The desirable state of affairs which the <fen>Patrol</fen> hopes to ensure by visiting <fen>Ground</fen>.
>The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Patrol</fen> examines the <fen>Ground</fen>.
The person who takes possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> takes possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The location of the <fen>Theme</fen> prior to the taking.
When the taking takes place.
Where the taking takes place.
The <fen>Gatherer</fen> is the agent gathering the <fen>Crop</fen>.
<fen>Crop</fen> is item being collected together by the <fen>Gatherer</fen>.
The <fex name='Source'>Source</fex> is the ground where the <fex name='Crop'>Crop</fex> is gathered from.
When the <fen>Crop</fen> gathering action occurs.
The greater geographic location where the <fen>Gatherer</fen> gathers his <fen>Crop</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>We</fex> 've been renting from him for years .
I tried to hire <fex>a bicycle</fex> .
I rented the car <fex>right next to the airport</fex> .
The police arrested Harry <fex>on charges of manslaughter</fex>.
<fex>The police</fex> arrested Harry on charges of manslaughter.
The police arrested <fex>Harry</fex> on charges of manslaughter.
They arrested Harry <fex>for shoplifting</fex>.
The police arrested Harry <fex>on Wednesday afternoon</fex>.
The police arrested Harry <fex>in front of his house</fex>.
<fex>Detective Jones</fex> patrolled the northern half of the building.
Four soldiers with submachine guns patrolled <fex>the room</fex>, and an officer made his rounds at frequent intervals.
Security guards patrolled <fex>for intruders</fex> while the game was in progress.
Patrol all unlit areas <fex>to ensure no one is hiding there</fex>.
All our grounds are regularly patrolled <fex>for safety</fex>.
Officerspoliced the parade grounds <fex>during the Memorial day events.</fex> .
<fex>Milton</fex> took the can of beer out of the refrigerator.
Milton took <fex>the can of beer</fex> out of the refrigerator.
Milton took the can of beer <fex>out of the refrigerator</fex>.
The government seizure of a suspected dissident's computer <fex>last November</fex> has increased the tension between citizens and law enforcement.
Police seized several tons of marijuana <fex>in Berkeley</fex> last weekend.
<fex>Small growers</fex> can harvest quality crops.
<fex>Tubers</fex> harvested immediately after spraying developed gangrene.
They picked the apples <fex>from the tallest trees</fex>.
